title: Pakistani Nationals Failing To Leave India Face 3 Years Jail Term, Rs 3 Lakh Fine
content: Any Pakistani, who fails to leave India as per the deadlines set by the government, will be arrested, prosecuted and may face a jail term of up to three years or a fine of a maximum Rs 3 lakh or both.

title: What Was Canada's Robocalls Controversy That Shook Voter Trust In 2011
content: With Canadians preparing to cast their ballots, memories of the 2011 Robocalls Scandal still linger - a voter suppression controversy that shook public trust and remains one of the most divisive chapters in the country's electoral history.

title: UP Woman Stopped At Attari Border While Trying To Return To Husband In Pak
content: The woman, a resident of Uttar Pradesh, was among the short-term visa holders who were ordered to leave India by Sunday in the wake of the Pahalgam attack.

title: "Time To Reclaim PoK": Trinamool Leader Abhishek Banerjee On Pahalgam Terror Attack
content: Trinamool Congress (TMC) leader Abhishek Banerjee on Sunday called for decisive action against Pakistan over the Pahalgam terror attack, saying it's time to "teach them a lesson in a language they understand" and "reclaim" PoK.

title: How Canada's 1974 Budget Toppled A Regime, Secured Pierre Trudeau's Comeback
content: Canada is heading to the polls on April 28 to decide whether Prime Minister Mark Carney's Liberal Party will retain power or if Pierre Poilievre's Conservatives will make a comeback after nearly a decade in opposition.

title: Student, Retired Teachers, Lawyer Among 25 Arrested For Remarks On J&K Attack
content: At least 25 people have been arrested in three states in the northeast over remarks on the terror attack in Pahalgam, which claimed 26 lives, including those of a Navy officer and an officer from the Intelligence Bureau.

title: Mani Shankar Aiyar Links Pahalgam With "Partition's Unresolved Issues". BJP Responds
content: Congress leader Mani Shankar Aiyar has come under attack from the BJP over his comments that the terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam that killed 26 tourists was a manifestation of "unresolved questions of the Partition."

title: Chief Of Defence Staff Meets Rajnath Singh Amid India-Pak Tension
content: Chief of General Staff (CDS) General Anil Chauhan arrived at the residence of Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Sunday to brief him on the key decisions taken up by the military to counter Pakistan following the terrorist attack in Pahalgam.

title: Watch: Delta Passengers Forced To Hold Plane Together After Ceiling Collapses Mid Flight
content: A recent Delta Air Lines flight from Atlanta to Chicago in the United States became a nightmare for passengers after the ceiling of the plane threatened to collapse mid-flight.

title: 5 Days After Attack, Hope, Confidence Take Over Pahalgam As Tourists Return
content: Pahalgam, hit by terror that cost 26 lives, appears to have bounced back with tourists who wanted to enjoy summer in Kashmir Valley, sticking to their travel plans. The refrain was -- "We thought it over and decided to come".

title: Sex Assault, Blackmail: Bhopal Case Draws Parallels To 1992 Ajmer Scandal
content: Some victims recounted being raped inside moving vehicles and threatened with weapons, while others were forced into drug addiction to break their resistance.

title: Video: Tyres Flung At Samajwadi Party MP's Convoy In UP. Akhilesh Yadav Reacts
content: The Samajwadi Party's Dalit MP Ramji Lal Suman was targeted yet again. Last month, his house was attacked in Agra. On Saturday, his convoy was hit with tyres and stones by a group of men from Karni Sena, protesting against his comments on Rana Sanga.

title: Exit Deadline Ends Today, 272 Pakistani Nationals Left India In 2 Days
content: Around 272 Pakistani nationals have left India in the past two days through the Attari-Wagah border point and a few hundred more are expected to exit on Sunday when the deadline for the 12 categories of short-term Pakistan visa holders ends.

title: Why Trump's Blue Suit At Pope's Funeral Became Unexpected Talking Point
content: As world leaders gathered in solemnity at St Peter'sBasilica to bid farewell to Pope Francis, US President Donald Trump's choice of outfit became an unexpected talking point.

title: 'Let's find out who's culprit': Pak seeks Russia, China involvement in Pahalgam probe
content: Amidst escalating tensions following the Pahalgam terror attack, Pakistan's defence minister has urged Russia, China, and Western nations to form an international investigation team, questioning India's accusations and demanding concrete evidence.

title: Pahalgam attack: 15 local cadres helped terrorists, probe reveals
content: Indian authorities have identified fifteen local Kashmiri overground workers (OGWs) as suspects in facilitating the recent Pahalgam terror attack. Electronic surveillance revealed their potential involvement in logistics and arms procurement from Pakistan. Three prime suspects are detained, with police seeking two others.

title: 'Is your wife paid by ... ?': Assam CM Himanta vs Gaurav Gogoi fight turns ugly
content: Assam chief minister Himanta Biswa Sarma has raised questions about a Congress MP. Sarma inquired about the MP's visit to Pakistan. He also questioned the MP's wife's salary from a Pakistan-based NGO. Sarma further asked about the citizenship of the MP's wife and children. These allegations follow previous statements about a possible Interpol probe.

title: Mumbai Indians create history, become first IPL team to record ...
content: Mumbai Indians achieved a significant milestone in the Indian Premier League. They secured their 150th victory, a first in IPL history. Mumbai defeated Lucknow Super Giants by 54 runs. Suryakumar Yadav and Ryan Rickelton scored impressive fifties. Jasprit Bumrah's outstanding bowling performance further solidified Mumbai's win. This victory propelled Mumbai Indians to second place in the points table.

title: Tesla CEO Musk is not 'happy', says 'We should have been...'
content: Elon Musk expressed his disappointment that humans haven't reached Mars yet, despite SpaceX's efforts. He referenced the rapid progress from the first flight to the moon landing, highlighting the current delay in space exploration.

title: Tamil Nadu ministers Senthil Balaji, K Ponmudy quit MK Stalin's Cabinet
content: Tamil Nadu ministers Senthil Balaji and K Ponmudy have resigned from Chief Minister MK Stalin's Cabinet, as confirmed by Raj Bhavan. Governor TN Ravi accepted their resignations amidst legal challenges. Balaji faces scrutiny in the cash-for-jobs scam, while Ponmudy is under fire for alleged hate speech against religious groups and women.

title: 'I bowl when I am required': Mumbai Indians skipper makes a big revelation
content: Mumbai Indians secured a dominant 54-run victory against Lucknow Super Giants, fueled by attacking half-centuries from Ryan Rickelton and Suryakumar Yadav. Jasprit Bumrah's exceptional bowling, along with Trent Boult's impactful spells, restricted LSG to 161. Hardik Pandya explained his limited bowling role, emphasizing the opportunity given to debutant Corbin Bosch, as MI climbed to second in the standings.

title: Russia launches nearly 150 drones on Ukraine as Trump questions Putin
content: Overnight, Russia launched extensive drone and airstrike attacks across Ukraine, resulting in at least four fatalities and multiple injuries, as reported by Ukrainian officials. The attacks targeted regions including Kostyantynivka and Pavlohrad, causing significant damage and casualties. Amidst these events, Donald Trump expressed skepticism regarding Vladimir Putin's commitment to ending the war, hinting at potential further sanctions against Moscow.

title: Bill Gates $16m gift to daughter that went against Melinda's middle class upbringing
content: Bill Gates reportedly gifted his daughter Jennifer a $15.82 million horse farm in North Salem, Westchester, following her Stanford graduation in 2018. The estate, equipped with equestrian facilities, supports Jennifer's passion for competitive horse riding. This purchase contrasts with Melinda Gates' past statements emphasizing a modest upbringing for their children, sparking discussions about wealth and values within the family.

title: Jasprit Bumrah's brilliance blows away Lucknow Super Giants
content: Jasprit Bumrah's exceptional bowling performance, claiming 4 for 22, propelled Mumbai Indians to a dominant victory over Lucknow Super Giants. Mumbai Indians, after being put into bat, posted a formidable 215 for 7, fueled by Ishan Kishan's 58 and Suryakumar Yadav's 54.

title: Sanjiv Goenka memes flood internet again after Pant flop show
content: Rishabh Pant faced another setback against Mumbai Indians. He scored only four runs. His struggles led to memes featuring Sanjiv Goenka. Mumbai Indians posted a strong total of 215/7. Ryan Rickelton and Suryakumar Yadav hit half-centuries. Lucknow Super Giants bowlers struggled. Mayank Yadav and Avesh Khan took two wickets each.

title: Musk replies to Vance's family photos from Taj Mahal: 'One of the ... '
content: US Vice President JD Vance, accompanied by his family, recently visited the Taj Mahal during a four-day trip to India. Vance shared photos on X, with Elon Musk commenting on the monument's beauty. The family's visit included a warm welcome from Uttar Pradesh's Chief Minister and stringent security measures along their route.

title: Centre should tread carefully, not alienate innocent people, says Mehbooba Mufti
content: Following the Pahalgam attack, Mehbooba Mufti has called on the Centre to exercise caution during the ongoing security operations in Jammu and Kashmir. She urged the government to differentiate between terrorists and civilians, cautioning against alienating innocent people. Mufti also alleged mass arrests and demolition of houses, appealing to ensure civilians do not suffer, as alienation could aid terrorists.

title: Post-attack, tourists start to reappear in Pahalgam
content: Despite a recent terrorist attack that killed 26 tourists, Pahalgam is gradually welcoming visitors again. Tourists are returning, drawn by the area's beauty and the absence of travel restrictions. Locals and security personnel are supportive, and businesses are offering discounts. While Baisaran meadow remains closed, other attractions are open, signaling a slow return to normalcy for the picturesque resort town.

title: Congress leader from Alur in Kurnool district murdered in Guntakal
content: Assailants hit Lakshminarayana’s car with a tipper and hacked him to death with hunting sickles, say police

title: Panels to ensure continuation of annual pokkali rice and fish cycle
content: The move comes in the wake of complaints from farmers that the coastal paddy fields have not yet been drained in preparation for sowing ahead of the rainy season

title: VAC signals require 6% to 17% manual interference to accommodate Bengaluru traffic
content: According to BTP officials, on average, while these systems run on an automated mode about 94% of the time (in a day), during the remaining 6% (majorly during the evening peak hours) they must be manually operated.

title: Rayala Sports Complex inaugurated in Kurnool
content: District Principal and Sessions Judge G. Kabarthi expresses happiness over the establishment of the complex and asks sports enthusiasts to make use of the facility as it would serve as a good opportunity to hone their skills

title: Delta region’s only coconut marketing complex in Pattukottai remains idle
content: The facility Ponnvarayankadu, built in 2011 at an estimate of ₹8 crore and renovated in 2022, remains non-functional; officials say they plan to hold meeting with farmers

title: Residents oppose felling of 368 trees for commercial project at Cantonment Railway Colony
content: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has issued a public notice inviting objections to the proposed felling of 368 trees located inside the Bangalore Cantonment Railway Colony at Vasanth Nagar.

title: Tamil Nadu government’s financial aid to power utility has risen by around 300% in 10 years
content: A huge financial outgo from the State government to the power utility is one of the key factors for its continued relatively-high revenue and fiscal deficits

title: Members of banned Jamaat-e-Islami launch new political party in J&K
content: People feel that their real representatives are not on the ground and the Justice and Development Front (JDF) has been launched to fill that void, says party general secretary Sayar Reshi. The party’s founding principles are justice, development and public welfare, he says

title: War should be the nation’s last resort, says Siddaramaiah after his statement draws criticism
content: ‘I did not say war against Pakistan is not necessary. What I said was that we are ready for war if needed. War should always be a nation’s last resort-never the first nor the only option’

title: "Acute Shortage Of Judges" Leading To Cases Going Unheard: High Court
content: The Delhi High Court has highlighted the "acute shortage of judges" with respect to the population and the litigation quantum due to which several matters remain unheard.

title: 28 Dead, Over 1,000 Injured In Iran Port Fire, Blast Heard 50 Km Away: 10 Points
content: Smoke shrouded Iran's largest commercial port and surrounding areas as a fire following a major blast killed 28 people and injured more than 1,000 so far. Strong winds posed hindrances to firefighting operations.

title: Live: High-Level Meet On Pahalgam Attack Amid India-Pak Tensions
content: Pahalgam terror attack updates: Tensions between India and Pakistan have soared after a terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir left 26 people dead this week.

title: 2 Children Killed In Massive Fire At Slum In Delhi's Rohini
content: At least two people lost their lives in a fire that broke out at a jhuggi (slum) near Shri Niketan Apartment in Sector 17 of Rohini in the national capital on Sunday, police said.

title: Canada Elections 2025: Possible Outcomes If No Party Wins A Majority
content: Canada will go to polls on April 28 in what's a tight race between the Liberal Party, led by Prime Minister Mark Carney, and the Conservative Party, headed by Pierre Poilievre.

title: Canada Election 2025: Inflation To National Security, Issues Dominating The Polls
content: The stage is set for a fierce contest between two dominant political forces in Canada. The Liberal Party, led by Mark Carney, faces a crucial challenge in holding onto power after Justin Trudeau's leadership transition.

title: Army trains village defence groups in Rajouri after Pahalgam terror attack
content: Following the recent terror attack in Pahalgam on April 22, the Indian Army has intensified security measures by providing specialized training to Village Defence Groups (VDGs) in the Nowshera sector of Rajouri district. This initiative aims to bolster security along sensitive border areas, equipping local communities with essential skills in weapon handling and tactical response.

title: Rishabh Pant's horror run continues in IPL 2025
content: Rishabh Pant's struggles continued with a two-ball dismissal against Mumbai Indians, contributing to his disappointing season tally of just 110 runs in ten games. Mumbai Indians, powered by half-centuries from Ryan Rickelton and Suryakumar Yadav, posted a formidable 215/7. Rickelton's rapid fifty and Yadav's innovative innings propelled MI, while LSG's Mayank Yadav and Avesh Khan took two wickets each.

title: Bumrah becomes Mumbai Indians' leading wicket-taker in IPL history
content: Jasprit Bumrah etched his name in Mumbai Indians' history, surpassing Lasith Malinga to become the franchise's highest wicket-taker in IPL. Bumrah achieved this milestone against Lucknow Super Giants, claiming his 171st wicket. Suryakumar Yadav's explosive half-century and Ryan Rickelton's contribution propelled MI to a formidable total, fueling their playoff aspirations in IPL 2025.

title: Bomb scare on IndiGo flight: Canadian detained for making threat
content: A Canadian citizen triggered panic at Varanasi airport on Saturday night after falsely claiming to have a bomb on an IndiGo flight headed to Bengaluru. The aircraft was immediately grounded and thoroughly inspected, leading to the passenger's detention and a detailed investigation. No explosives were found, and the flight resumed its journey on Sunday morning after security clearance.

title: 'There were failures': Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Pahalgam terror attack
content: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor rejected Pakistan's call for a probe into the Pahalgam terror attack, emphasizing Pakistan cannot investigate its own alleged crimes. He acknowledged security lapses but urged focusing on the larger picture, drawing parallels with Israel's intelligence failure on October 7. Tharoor also expressed concern over the human cost of strained India-Pakistan relations due to cross-border terrorism.

title: Is there a Trump vs judiciary tussle over immigration enforcement?
content: Donald Trump's recent poll on Truth Social, questioning the prosecution of judges and politicians aiding illegal immigrants, has ignited a national debate. This follows the arrest of Wisconsin Judge Hannah Dugan for allegedly obstructing the apprehension of a deported Mexican national. Judge Monica Isham voiced strong support for Dugan, threatening defiance.

title: Suryakumar Yadav creates history, becomes fastest Indian to 4000 IPL runs
content: Suryakumar Yadav achieved a significant milestone, becoming the fastest Indian to score 4000 IPL runs in just 2705 balls, surpassing previous records. His explosive batting has been instrumental in Mumbai Indians' recent success, contributing to their four-match winning streak. Yadav's current form also places him at the forefront of the Orange Cap race this season.

title: Why new GST Appellate Tribunal rules are 'game-changer for taxpayers'
content: India's GST dispute resolution is set for a major overhaul with the notification of the GSTAT Procedure Rules, 2025, effective April 24, 2025. These rules establish a digital-first, transparent framework to tackle pending GST appeals, reducing reliance on High Courts. The move aims to expedite resolutions, boost taxpayer trust, and align with India’s ease of doing-business goals.

title: Pakistan confirms India's withdrawal from Volleyball championship
content: India has withdrawn from the Central Asian Volleyball tournament in Islamabad. The Pakistan Volleyball Federation announced India's cancellation. A delegation of 30 members was expected. The reason cited is the Pahalgam terrorist incident. Diplomatic relations between India and Pakistan have worsened. Afghanistan or Sri Lanka may replace India. The tournament will feature teams from Iran, Turkmenistan, Kyrgyzstan, Tajikistan, and Uzbekistan.

title: Is it? Suryakumar Yadav's priceless reaction after hearing his unique record
content: Suryakumar Yadav's explosive 54 off 28 balls against Lucknow Super Giants propelled him to become the second-fastest to reach 4000 IPL runs. His remarkable innings, achieving the milestone in 2714 deliveries, helped him secure the Orange Cap with 417 runs.

title: Bengaluru-bound Air India Express stranded in Saudi Arabia for over 18 hours
content: Over 150 Bengaluru-bound passengers were stranded in Dammam for over 24 hours due to repeated technical issues with Air India Express Flight IX484. Passengers faced significant delays and expressed safety concerns after the aircraft halted abruptly on the runway. Advocate Hameed Padubidri criticized the airline's negligence and lack of passenger care, urging aviation authorities to investigate the recurring disruptions.

title: 'Yeh nahi sudhrega': Digvesh can't stop despite hefty fines
content: Digvesh Rathi, Lucknow Super Giants' spinner, faces hefty fines totaling Rs 5,62,500 for his repeated "notebook" celebration deemed unsportsmanlike by IPL officials. Despite warnings and demerit points, Rathi continues the gesture after dismissing batsmen, sparking debate among fans regarding his on-field conduct and the boundaries of celebratory expression in T20 cricket.

title: 'Kohli and I have spoken about it many times': KL Rahul on IPL regret
content: KL Rahul reminisces about RCB's heartbreaking 2016 IPL final loss to SRH, a defeat he and Virat Kohli have often discussed. Despite a strong season and reaching the final, RCB fell short of the target. Rahul credits his time at RCB, learning from Kohli, AB de Villiers, and Gayle, for his growth and belief in his white-ball skills.

title: Jacqueline approached for Sukesh's docuseries? Here's what we know
content: A major OTT platform is developing a documentary series on conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar's life, including the ₹200 crore extortion scandal involving actress Jacqueline Fernandez. The platform has approached Fernandez to share her perspective on their relationship and the extravagant gifts she received. Production is slated for mid-2026, navigating complex legal clearances.

title: 'Terrorist didn't ask religion', says Cong minister on Pahalgam attack
content: Karnataka minister TB Thimmapur's remark, dismissing religious motives in the Pahalgam terror attack, ignited a political firestorm. His statement, contradicting victims' accounts, was seen as an attempt to downplay intelligence failures. The BJP strongly condemned the Congress, accusing them of shielding Pakistan and insulting the victims, while Chief Minister Siddaramaiah clarified his stance on avoiding immediate war with Pakistan.

title: 'Do not want war to flare up': Pakistan on relations with India
content: Pakistan has called for an independent investigation into the Pahalgam terror attack, denying any involvement and expressing concerns about escalating tensions. Pakistan's defence minister dismissed claims of Lashkar-e-Taiba's involvement, stating the outfit is contained. Amidst rising tensions, Pakistan welcomed Iran's offer to mediate, reaffirming its desire for regional peace and condemning terrorism.

title: Environmentalist defend conocarpus plant, slam ‘unscientific attack’
content: Originating in Yemen, the Conocarpus plant is now widely grown in countries like Dubai, Kuwait, and Abu Dhabi, contributing to 70 percent of their green cover

title: Thiruvananthapuram airport, railway station receive hoax bomb threats
content: The police swiftly responded with precautionary measures, though operations at both prominent transit hubs remained unaffected

title: Union Minister exhorts States to contribute to achieving energy consumption target
content: State Designated Agencies urged to adopt Energy Conservation and Sustainable Building Code for commercial buildings, and Eco Niwas Samhita for residential buildings

title: As mercury level goes up, prices of tender coconut skyrocket in Bengaluru
content: Tender coconut growers also cite declining yield and changing environmental conditions for the shortage in supply eventually leading to soaring prices.

title: Applications invited for higher secondary teacher transfer for 2025-26
content: Government wants to complete transfers by the end of May to facilitate joining of teachers in their new schools before June 1

title: Vizag police bust nine-member gang allegedly involved in loan app fraud, seize ₹60 lakh worth cryptocurrency
content: The prime accused in the case has confessed that he has been lured into committing the crime by two Chinese cybercriminals, says Commissioner of Police Shankabratha Bagchi

title: Nellore police bust seven-member cybercriminal gang
content: Chinna Bazar police officials arrest five persons from Rajasthan and two locals, who duped a woman of ₹2.46 crore in online investment scam

title: Disproportionate assets case: Satheesan demands K.M. Abraham’s resignation
content: He asks the CM to halt the “extravagant” celebrations being held to mark the fourth anniversary of the LDF government

title: Gadkari and Kishan Reddy to launch national highway projects worth ₹5,413 crore in Telangana on May 5
content: Cost of construction is pegged at about ₹13,000 crore and 50% of land acquisition cost is estimated at about ₹2,230 crore

title: Mayank Yadav marks fiery comeback, dismisses Rohit Sharma at Wankhede
content: Mayank Yadav marked a triumphant return to cricket for Lucknow Super Giants, dismissing Rohit Sharma in their IPL match against Mumbai Indians. After recovering from injury, Yadav showcased impressive pace, reaching speeds over 140 kmph. Despite Sharma hitting him for consecutive sixes, Yadav bounced back with a slower delivery, leading to Sharma's dismissal, providing a significant boost for LSG.

title: Watch: Hundreds gather in Toronto to condemn Pahalgam terror attack
content: In Toronto, hundreds of Canadians from diverse backgrounds united for a candlelight vigil and rally, condemning the Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26 people. Organized by Hindu Forum Canada and other groups, the event drew Hindus, Jews, Baloch, and Iranians who marched, chanted slogans, and urged the Canadian government to designate Pakistan as a terrorist state.

title: 'Combat ready': Indian Navy test fires anti-ship missiles in Arabian Sea
content: The Indian Navy successfully conducted anti-ship missile firings, demonstrating its readiness to safeguard maritime interests amidst heightened tensions following the Pahalgam terror attack. INS Surat, the latest indigenous guided missile destroyer, also test-fired the MR-SAM system, enhancing defense capabilities.

title: 16 arrested in Assam for making 'seditious comments' on Pahalgam attack
content: Assam police arrested sixteen individuals for alleged seditious comments following the Pahalgam terror attack. Among those arrested is AIUDF MLA, Aminul Islam. Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma indicated the possible use of the National Security Act. Sarma condemned Pakistani politician Bilawal Bhutto Zardari’s anti-India statements. India suspended the Indus Water Treaty of 1960, citing Pakistan's support for cross-border terrorism.

title: Virat & Anushka moved to London to raise their kids away from limelight: Nene
content: For a while now, there’s been a lot of buzz about Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli moving to London. The couple has been spotted several times in the UK, and people close to them have quietly hinted that the move is indeed happening. Now, Madhuri Dixit’s husband, Dr Sriram Nene, has opened up about the real reason why Anushka and Virat decided to relocate with their kids Vamika and Akaay.

title: 'No immediate war with Pak': Siddaramaiah clarifies his remark
content: Karnataka chief minister Siddaramaiah clarified his remarks regarding potential conflict with Pakistan following the Pahalgam terror attack, emphasising that while war is undesirable, ensuring national security remains the central government's responsibility. He criticized the Centre for alleged security lapses in the region, referencing the earlier Pulwama attack and questioning Prime Minister Modi's absence from the all-party meeting.

title: Why Shardul Thakur is not playing today's match between MI, LSG?
content: Mayank Yadav replaced Shardul Thakur in Lucknow Super Giants' playing XI against Mumbai Indians, marking his return after an extended rehabilitation for a back injury. Mumbai Indians made two changes, including debutant Corbin Bosch. Rishabh Pant won the toss and chose to field first, citing favorable conditions for batting in the second innings.

title: Uddhav-Raj Thackeray reunion: Are leaders ready for alliance?
content: Rumors of a reunion between Uddhav and Raj Thackeray gain traction as both Shiv Sena (UBT) and MNS leaders acknowledge the need to address organizational alignment and personal relationships. Recent statements suggest a willingness to reconcile after 20 years, driven by challenging political circumstances and poor electoral performances.

title: Videos show aftermath of deadly Vancouver Lapu Lapu Day SUV crash
content: A devastating incident at Vancouver's Lapu Lapu Day festival occurred when a vehicle plowed into the crowd, resulting in multiple fatalities and numerous injuries. The driver has been apprehended, and an investigation is underway. Political leaders have expressed their condolences to the victims' families and the Filipino community, while praising the first responders at the scene of the tragedy.

title: Yatnal accuses Siddaramaiah of speaking as Pakistan agent over Pahalgam terror attack
content: Being a Chief Minister and an Indian citizen, he does not have any shame in making such a shabby remark, says the Vijayapura MLA

title: LoC remains tense; J&K parties caution against demolition drive
content: Indian and Pakistani troops exchange small arms fire; on demolitions, J&K Chief Minister Omar Abdullah says “don’t let innocent people become collateral damage”

title: LSGD issues guidelines to ensure quality and regular supply of inoculum for biodegradable waste processing
content: Lack of availability of inoculum at regular intervals and of proper quality has been a problem faced by those who adopted these methods

title: Three-member gang arrested for multiple burglaries across 9 districts
content: The police recovered 400 grams of gold ornaments, 500 grams of silver ornaments, and six cell phones

title: Former MLA urges State and Centre to renew FRCA of RDT
content: The services of RTD, which works for the upliftment of the poor, are not just limited to Anantapur, but extend across Andhra Pradesh and Telangana, says YSRCP leader

title: Andhra Pradesh High Court calls for data pertaining to ‘sewer deaths’ from 1993
content: The aim is to compensate the families of all those who have died under such situations in all the municipal corporations, municipalities and local bodies, the court observes, and posts the matter for further hearing to July 16

title: NIOS-passed candidate eligible for admission to law degree courses: HC
content: Justice N. Nagaresh made the observation recently while quashing an order of the Principal of S.N. Law College, Poothotta, Thripunithura

title: Lightning kills two youth in Kurnool
content: The group of youth had gathered on Sunday to play cricket in an open field. During play, the weather changed, bringing rain, and light winds

title: Retired CRPF personnel fires at daughter, son-in-law in Maharashtra
content: Tripti Wagh, 24, died on the spot; she had married Avinash Wagh, who was critically injured in the incident, against her father’s wishes

title: Prime Minister should announce grant instead of loan for construction of capital in Amaravati, says CPI(M)
content: There are suspicions among people that Narendra Modi may once again bring water and soil to Amaravati during his visit on May 2, say the party leaders in an open letter

title: Of a Madanapalle woman and her five children holding Pakistani citizenship
content: In the light of the Centre’s April 27 deadline for Pakistan citizens to leave the country, the case of Gulab Jan assumes significance as she has been residing in the town for the past two decades and has got her children educated, right from LKG to graduation, locally; the police have issued a notice to the five grown-up citizens of Pakistan to leave immediately

title: Tributes pour in for Pahalgam terror victims in Telangana
content: Twin cities residents pay tribute to Pahalgam terror attack victims with candle-light rallies and prayers for peace

title: Two groups clash in Latur; teacher unconnected to incident beaten to death
content: The clash took place on Saturday afternoon in Aundha village in connection with a procession to mark the birth anniversary of Babasaheb Ambedkar, which is celebrated on April 14

title: Choose a career of your interest, students told
content: Take guidance but make your own decision, says Director of Bapuji Institute of Engineering and Technology

title: Government will fulfil all pre-poll promises: A.P. Industries Minister
content: NDA government has fulfilled its promise to enhance financial assistance to the fishermen during the fishing ban period from ₹10,000 to ₹20,000, says T.G. Bharath

title: Actor Mahesh Babu cites scheduling conflict, ED questioning postponed
content: While Mahesh Babu is not currently an accused in the case, the ED is examining the financial transactions related to his endorsements

title: Poultry waste recycling unit to be set up at Ariyamangalam dump yard in Tiruchi
content: Land has been identified for the unit, which will operate under contract for three years and will have the capacity to process around 50 tonnes of waste daily

title: Russian House to organise Soviet victory festival in Thiruvananthapuram from April 30
content: 9-day event will feature seminars, exhibitions, competitions, a war film festival and a musical performance

title: All March releases, except Empuraan, flopped at box office, as per producers’ association’s figures
content: Collection records put out by producers’ association are partial as it takes into account only producers’ share from Kerala theatres after excluding overseas revenues, OTT revenues and exhibitors’ share

title: Consumer body moots accreditation council for grading schools on the lines of NAAC
content: A reputed academic who has retired from service can head the council which should function on the lines of the National Assessment and Accreditation Council, says the  consumer body

title: Bhoothathankettu hydroelectric project: Kerala State Electricity Board decides to terminate contract with consortium
content: Decision follows dispute over despatch of the third and final consignment of equipment from China. The KSEB has inked the agreement for electromechanical work for ₹81.80 crore with August 2016 as completion date

title: Brain dead woman’s organs give new lease of life to three individuals
content: With the consent of the deceased’s husband, son, and other family members, her liver and both kidneys were donated and transported to the recipients through a specially arranged Green Channel

title: VHP objects to Railway Recruitment Board’s instructions to remove ‘mangalasutra, religious symbols’ to appear for Nursing Superintendent examination
content: In his post Mr. Pumpwell interpreted that ‘religious symbols’ also included ‘janivara’ (‘sacred thread’).

title: Thuraiyur Chinna Eri awaits rejuvenation while inflow of untreated sewage continues
content: A plan to rehabilitate and rejuvenate the lake, mooted by Municipal Administration Minister K.N. Nehru, during an inspection in November 2024, is yet to take off; the municipality is establishing an STP

title: Sreemathy denies reports of being barred from CPI(M) State secretariat
content: Reports claimed that she was barred from the State secretariat since the relaxation in age given to her at the party’s central committee is not applicable at the State level

title: Watch: Pahalgam Attack | What was discussed in all-party meeting?
content: In this episode of Talking Politics, we will discuss the major points that were discussed in the all-party meeting and its outcome

title: Siddaramaiah should consider moving to Pakistan, says Jagadish Shettar after Karnataka CM’s anti-war comment
content: Siddaramaiah had said on April 26 that there was no need for a war, but strict measures to strengthen security in the State should be taken.

title: Assam CM announces crackdown on Aadhaar cardholders not in the NRC
content: The State government decided in December 2024 to toughen the Aadhaar card mechanism and link it with the National Register of Citizens

title: Bomb scare on Varanasi-Bengaluru IndiGo flight, Canadian detained
content: Following the bomb scare, the aircraft was moved to the isolation bay for a thorough inspection, but no explosive material was found, said Puneet Gupta, Director of the airport

title: Internal reservation: Dalit right and left groups start awareness campaigns on choice of nomenclature
content: Survey to map Scheduled Castes in Karnataka and their socio, economic and education levels will get underway from May 5

title: Permissions from Department of Ports mandatory for fishing and tourist boats in Godavari
content: The officials are set to intensify vigil on the illegal entry of non-residents on the islands of river Godavari and illegal tourism activities

title: Centre should not alienate innocent people, says Mehbooba Mufti on anti-terror crackdown in Kashmir
content: “The Indian Government must tread with caution and carefully distinguish between terrorists and civilians following the recent Pahalgam attack”, Ms. Mufti said in a post on ‘X’.

title: Gordon's putback slam beats buzzer, sinks Clips
content: Aaron Gordon's putback dunk just beat the final buzzer, giving the Nuggets a dramatic 101-99 win over the Clippers after Denver squandered a 22-point lead.

title: Browns end Sanders' slide, pick QB in 5th round
content: The Browns traded up in the fifth round Saturday and selected quarterback Shedeur Sanders at No. 144 overall, ending the Colorado star's NFL draft free fall.

title: With Butler out, Curry, Dubs get tough in key win
content: Stephen Curry had 36 points, and the Warriors delivered perhaps their gutsiest performance of the season in a 104-93 win to take a 2-1 series lead over the Rockets.

title: D-backs' Suárez slugs four HRs in loss to Braves
content: Diamondbacks third baseman Eugenio Suarez became the 19th player in major league history to hit four home runs in a game Saturday night, doing so against the Braves.

title: Steelers, waiting on Rodgers, draft QB Howard
content: The Steelers selected Ohio State's Will Howard with the 185th pick in the sixth round Saturday, adding a quarterback to their depth chart while they continue to wait on an answer from Aaron Rodgers.

title: Assefa takes London Marathon win in record time
content: Tigst Assefa of Ethiopia secured her first London Marathon title, finishing in 2:15:50 for the fastest-ever time in a women's-only marathon. Kenya's Sabastian Sawe won the men's race in his London debut.

title: Ravens draft kicker with Tucker's future uncertain
content: The Ravens drafted a kicker for the first time in their team history, which creates more uncertainty surrounding Justin Tucker's future in Baltimore.

title: Dolphins: QB Ewers 'made sense' in 7th round
content: The Dolphins selected Texas quarterback Quinn Ewers with the 231st pick in the seventh round Saturday.

title: Browns gamble on Shedeur Sanders after drafting Dillon Gabriel: What's the plan?
content: Answering the biggest questions surrounding Cleveland's selection of Sanders in the fifth round, including reaction from around the league.

title: Wrexham's latest promotion is a miracle. The next will be even harder
content: Wrexham's third straight promotion has them on the Premier League's doorstep. Getting there will be much harder.

title: 'There's no drop-off down there': How the bottom of the order is powering the Cubs' offense to top of MLB
content: Chicago has scored more runs than any team in the majors so far -- with the help of some unexpected sluggers.

title: Barça's Copa del Rey win shows Madrid have more to worry about than referees
content: Barcelona's Clasico supremacy continues, pushing rivals Real Madrid to the brink of a trophyless season.

title: 'He's a great leader': Cam Ward displays leadership abilities in texts to Titans draftees
content: The No. 1 pick in the 2025 NFL draft wasted no time building a rapport with his fellow Titans rookies.

title: Yamal: Madrid can't handle Copa-winning Barça
content: Lamine Yamal says Real Madrid can't handle Barcelona this season after Hansi Flick's side came from behind to beat their Clásico rivals and win the Copa del Rey on Saturday.

title: Reynolds, Wrexham eye PL after historic promotion
content: Ryan Reynolds said Wrexham are targeting the Premier League after the Hollywood-owned club secured a historic third-successive promotion to claim a place in the EFL Championship.

title: Madrid have 3 sent off in testy end to Copa final
content: Jude Bellingham, Antonio Rüdiger and Lucas Vázquez were all shown red cards in the dramatic closing stages of Real Madrid's 3-2 extra-time defeat to Barcelona in the Copa del Rey final on Saturday.

title: Courage end KC's perfect start with stunning win
content: The previously winless North Carolina Courage scored twice in the final minutes of the game to hand the first-place Kansas City Current their first loss of the NWSL season on Saturday.

title: Amorim: 'No regrets' about taking Man Utd job
content: Ruben Amorim said he has "no regrets" about taking the Manchester United job but added he had to shake off doubts about the timing of his appointment.

title: Kane suspended for Bayern's title-winning game
content: Harry Kane will miss Bayern Munich's Bundesliga match against RB Leipzig next Saturday due to suspension.

title: Ronaldo goal leads Al Nassr into Asian CL semis
content: Cristiano Ronaldo led Saudi Arabian team Al-Nassr to a 4-1 win over Yokohama F. Marinos of Japan in the quarterfinals of the AFC Champions League Elite on Saturday.

title: Eubank Jr. should focus on Canelo, rather than Benn rematch
content: Forget a rematch with Conor Benn, the focus for Chris Eubank Jr should now fully be on Canelo Alvarez

title: The biggest question facing every WNBA team when training camp opens Sunday
content: Who will carry Phoenix into its new era? What will Reese and Cardoso do in Year 2? Are the Fever title contenders?

title: 2025 NFL draft: Fantasy football analysis of Rounds 1-3
content: Liz Loza, Matt Bowen and Mike Clay break down the fantasy potential of early-round rookies from the NFL draft and provide initial 2025 projections.

title: Should you draft Caitlin Clark or A'ja Wilson at No. 1?
content: A'ja Wilson opened as the top ranked player in fantasy women's basketball entering the 2025 season, but does someone else have a case to supplant Wilson in 2025?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona eye Atlético's Álvarez to replace Lewandowski
content: Barcelona have identified Atlético Madrid's Julián Álvarez as Robert Lewandowski's successor. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Transfer portal's lure involves more than just a big payday for players

title: Draft overreactions on Sanders, Cousins, Giants, Jags and Steelers
